Parameters: Context: This value must never be null.
Uri: This value must never be null.
SliceMetrics(android.content.Context,and.Description: An object to be used throughout the life of a slice to register events.

logVisible().Description: To be called whenever the slice becomes visible to the user.

Parameters: int: The type of the event.
Uri: The URI of the sub-slice that is the subject of the interaction. This value must never be null.
logTouch(int, android.net.Uri).Description: To be called whenever the user invokes a discrete action via a slice. Use this for discrete events like a tap or the end of a drag, not for a continuous streams of events, such as the motion during a gesture.
logTouch(int, android.net.Uri).FullName: public void logTouch (int actionType, Uri subSlice)

logHidden().Description: To be called whenever the slice becomes invisible to the user.

Parameters: int: The type of the event.
Uri: The URI of the sub-slice that is the subject of the interaction. This value must never be null.
logTouch(int,android.net.Uri).Description: To be called whenever the user invokes a discrete action via a slice. Use this for discrete events like a tap or the end of a drag, not for a continuous streams of events, such as the motion during a gesture.
logTouch(int,android.net.Uri).FullName: public void logTouch (int actionType, Uri subSlice)

ClassDesc: Metrics interface for slices. This is called by SliceView, so Slice developers should not need to reference this class.
